briefdescription.para: Type of 0-attributes, a model of CellAttributeWithPoint concept (a shortcut for Attribute_type<0>::type ).
Descriptor through 0-attributes (a shortcut for Attribute_descriptor<0>::type ).
Const descriptor through 0-attributes (a shortcut for Attribute_const_descriptor<0>::type ).
Range of all the 0-attributes, a model of the Range concept (a shortcut for Attribute_range<0>::type ).

detaileddescription.para: Iterator inner type is bidirectional iterator and value type is Vertex_attribute.

briefdescription.para: Const range of all the 0-attributes, a model of the ConstRange concept a shortcut for Attribute_const_range<0>::type ).

detaileddescription.para: Iterator inner type is bidirectional iterator and value type is Vertex_attribute.

briefdescription.para: Ambient dimension, must be > 1.
Default constructor creating an empty linear cell complex.
Returns a range of all the 0-attributes in this linear cell complex (a shortcut for attributes<0>()).
Returns a const range of all the 0-attributes in this linear cell complex (a shortcut for attributes<0>() const).
Returns true iff this linear cell complex is valid.

detaileddescription.para: A linear cell complex lcc is valid if it is a valid generic map (cf. GenericMap::is_valid()), and if for each dart descriptor d such that d $ \in $ darts(): vertex_attribute(d)!=null_descriptor.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of 0-attributes in this linear cell complex (a shortcut for number_of_attributes<0>()).
Returns the 0-attribute associated with d.
Returns the 0-attribute associated with d, when d is const.
Returns the point in the 0-attribute v.
Returns the point in the 0-attribute v, when v is const.
Returns the point in the 0-attribute associated with d.
Returns the point in the 0-attribute associated with d, when d is const.
Creates a new dart in this linear cell complex, sets its associated 0-attribute to v and returns the corresponding descriptor.

Creates a new dart in this linear cell complex, creates a new 0-attribute initialized with apoint, sets the associated 0-attribute of the new dart to this new 0-attribute, and returns the corresponding descriptor.
Creates a new 0-attribute in this linear cell complex, and returns the corresponding descriptor (a shortcut for create_attribute<0>(t1)).

detaileddescription.para: Calls the constructor of Vertex_attribute having T1 as parameter. Overloads of this member function are defined that take from zero to nine arguments. With zero argument, create_vertex_attribute() creates a new 0-attribute by using the default constructor.

briefdescription.para: Removes the 0-attribute pointed to by v from this linear cell complex (a shortcut for erase_attribute<0>(v)).
Associates the 0-attribute of all the darts of the 0-cell containing d to v (a shortcut for set_attribute<0>(d,v)).
Correct the invalid attributes of the linear cell complex.

detaileddescription.para: We can have invalid attribute either if we have called set_automatic_attributes_management(false) before to use some modification operations or if we have modified the combinatorial map by using low level operations.

The validation process of a linear cell complex validates its generic map (cf. correct_invalid_attributes()), and for each dart d having no vertex attribute, a new vertex attribute is created, with its Point initialized to CGAL::Origin, and all the darts of the 0-cell containing d are linked with the new attribute.

briefdescription.para: Returns the barycenter of the i-cell containing d.
Inserts a point, copy of p, in the i-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this cell.
i $ \leq $ dimension $ \leq $ 2 and d $ \in $ darts().
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if i-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<i>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original i-attribute associated with d and a' each new i-attribute created during the operation.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the combinatorial map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a point in the barycenter of the i-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this cell.
i $ \leq $ dimension $ \leq $ 2 and d $ \in $ darts().
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if i-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<i>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original i-attribute associated with d and a' each new i-attribute created during the operation.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the combinatorial map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 1-cell in the 2-cell containing d, the 1-cell being attached only by one of its vertex to the 0-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The second vertex is associated with a new 0-attribute containing a copy of p as point. Returns a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 0-cell. 2 $ \leq $ dimension and d $ \in $ darts().
Advanced
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the combinatorial map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated segment in this linear cell complex (two darts linked by $ \beta_2$) having p0, p1 as points.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on the dart associated with p0.
dimension $ \geq$ 2.
Example of r=lcc.make_segment(p0,p1), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps. Example of r=lcc.make_segment(p0,p1), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps.

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated triangle in this linear cell complex having p0, p1, p2 as points.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on the dart associated with p0 and with edge [p0,p1].
dimension $ \geq$ 1.
Example of r=lcc.make_triangle(p0,p1,p2), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps. Example of r=lcc.make_triangle(p0,p1,p2), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p0, const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3)
memberdef.name: make_quadrangle

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated quadrangle in this linear cell complex having p0, p1, p2, p3 as points.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on the dart associated with p0 and with edge [p0,p1].
dimension $ \geq$ 1.
Example of r=lcc.make_quadrangle(p0,p1,p2,p3), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps. Example of r=lcc.make_quadrangle(p0,p1,p2,p3), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p0, const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3)
memberdef.name: make_tetrahedron

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated tetrahedron in this linear cell complex having p0, p1,p2,p3 as points.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on the dart associated with p0, with edge [p0,p1] and belonging to the 2-cell having p0, p1, p2 as points.
dimension $ \geq$ 2.
Example of r=lcc.make_tetrahedron(p0,p1,p2,p3), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps. Example of r=lcc.make_tetrahedron(p0,p1,p2,p3), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p0, const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3, const Point &p4, const Point &p5, const Point &p6, const Point &p7)
memberdef.name: make_hexahedron

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated hexahedron in this linear cell complex having p0, p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6, p7 as points.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on the dart associated with p0, with edge [p0,p5] and belonging to the 2-cell having p0, p5, p6, p1 as points.
dimension $ \geq $ 2.
Example of r=lcc.make_hexahedron(p0,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps. Example of r=lcc.make_hexahedron(p0,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7), left for combinatorial map as combinatorial data-structure, right for generalized maps.

briefdescription.para: The concept LinearCellComplex represents a linear cell complex in dimension d, in an ambient space of dimension d2. This is a model of the concept of GenericMap adding a requirement to ensure that each vertex of the map is associated with a model of CellAttributeWithPoint.
